tool.name: msms2metfrag
tool.description: Generate MetFrag parameters given MS/MS spectral information and CAMERA adduct annotation.
tool.command: mkdir outputfolder; /usr/local/bin/MS2ToMetFrag.r inputCAMERA=$msms2metfrag_input_2 inputMS2=$msms2metfrag_input_1 output=outputfolder precursorppm=$precursorppm fragmentppm=$fragmentppm fragmentabs=$fragmentabs database=$database maxSpectra=$maxSpectra minPeaks=$minPeaks maxPrecursorMass=$maxPrecursorMass minPrecursorMass=$minPrecursorMass mode=$mode adductRules=$adductRules;

param.name: msms2metfrag_input_1
param.label: map-msms2camera data
param.help: A rdata file mapped MS/MS spectra retrieved from map-msms2camera

param.name: msms2metfrag_input_2
param.label: camera-find-adducts data
param.help: A rdata file with a xsAnnotate object from one sample with annotated adduct information

param.name: precursorppm
param.label: Precursor PPM
param.help: The ppm error for the precursor mass to search candidates

param.name: fragmentppm
param.label: Fragment PPM (mzppm)
param.help: The ppm error to assign fragments to fragment peaks

param.name: fragmentabs
param.label: Fragment Abs (mzabs)
param.help: Absolute mass error to assign fragments to fragment peaks

param.name: minPeaks
param.label: Minimum number peaks
param.help: Filter spectra by a minimum number of fragment peaks

param.name: maxSpectra
param.label: Maximum number spectra
param.help: Filter spectra by a maximum number of fragment peaks

param.name: maxPrecursorMass
param.label: Maximal precursor mass
param.help: Filter spectra by a maximal precusor mass

param.name: minPrecursorMass
param.label: Minimal precursor mass
param.help: Filter spectra by a minimal precusor mass

param.name: mode
param.label: Mode
param.help: Ion mode for the data acquisition for this sample

===================== MS/MS to MetFrag =====================
----------- Description -----------
| This module is used to generate MetFrag CLI Batch parameters with mapped MS/MS spectra retrieved from **map-msms2camera** and CAMERA adduct information retrieved from **camera-find-adducts**.
----------- Input files -----------
+------------------------------+------------+ | File | Format | +==============================+============+ | 1) map-msms2camera data | rdata | +------------------------------+------------+ | 2) camera-find-adducts data | rdata | +------------------------------+------------+
---------- Parameters ----------
map-msms2camera data | A rdata file mapped MS/MS spectra retrieved from **map-msms2camera** |
camera-find-adducts data | A rdata file with a xsAnnotate object from one sample with annotated adduct information |
Precursor PPM | The ppm error for the precursor mass to search candidates |
Fragment PPM (mzppm) | The ppm error to assign fragments to fragment peaks |
Fragment Abs (mzabs) | Absolute mass error to assign fragments to fragment peaks |
Minimum number peaks | Filter spectra by a minimum number of fragment peaks |
Maximum number peaks | Filter spectra by a maximum number of fragment peaks |
Maximal precursor mass | Filter spectra by a maximal precusor mass |
Minimal precursor mass | Filter spectra by a minimal precusor mass |
Mode | Ion mode for the data acquisition for this sample (pos, neg) |
Database | Database used to search candidates | Available databases are: KEGG, PubChem, MetChem (local database which needs to be set up beforehand). In addition, LocalCSV can be used which uses a csv file for searching. Such a csv file can be downloaded from https://msbi.ipb-halle.de/~cruttkie/databases/ |
Adduct Rules | Adduct ruleset to be used: | primary - contains most common adduct types ([M-H]-, [M-2H+Na]-, [M-2H+K]-, [M+Cl]-, [M+H]+, [M+Na]+, [M+K]+, [M+NH4]+) | extended - next to primary also additional adduct types |
------------ Output files ------------
metfrag_parameters | txt file(s) containing MetFrag CLI Batch parameters |
